feature: Add focus trapping and role attributes to AlertDialog modal components
description: Implement proper focus management in AlertDialog components including focus trapping, role="alertdialog", aria-modal="true", and automatic focus return to trigger element on close.

phases.name: Create useFocusTrap Hook
phases.description: Create a reusable React hook for focus management in modal dialogs

subtasks.title: Create useFocusTrap hook file
subtasks.description: Create web/src/hooks/useFocusTrap.ts with the base hook structure that accepts a ref and isOpen boolean parameter
acceptance_criteria: Hook accepts containerRef and isOpen parameters
subtasks.notes: Created useFocusTrap hook at web/src/hooks/useFocusTrap.ts with base structure. Hook accepts containerRef (RefObject<HTMLElement>) and options object with isOpen, onClose, and initialFocusRef parameters. Properly typed with TypeScript interfaces and JSDoc documentation.

subtasks.title: Implement focus trap logic
subtasks.description: Implement the core focus trapping logic: find all focusable elements, trap Tab/Shift+Tab within dialog, prevent focus escape
acceptance_criteria: Tab key cycles forward through focusable elements
Shift+Tab cycles backward through focusable elements
subtasks.notes:
Implemented core focus trapping logic in useFocusTrap hook:
- Added FOCUSABLE_SELECTOR constant with comprehensive CSS selector for focusable elements (buttons, inputs, selects, textareas, links, elements with tabindex, contenteditable)
- Created getFocusableElements() helper function that queries and filters elements by visibility
- Implemented handleKeyDown() callback for Tab/Shift+Tab keyboard event handling with proper cycling between first and last elements
- Implemented handleFocusIn() callback to redirect focus back to container if it escapes via click or programmatic focus
- Added event listeners with proper cleanup on unmount
- Sets tabindex="-1" on container to ensure it can receive focus if needed

subtasks.title: Implement auto-focus on open
subtasks.description: Auto-focus first focusable element when dialog opens, with option to specify a custom initial focus element
acceptance_criteria: First focusable element receives focus when dialog opens
Optional initialFocusRef parameter to override default behavior
subtasks.notes:
Implemented auto-focus functionality in useFocusTrap hook:
- Added useRef to track animation frame IDs for cleanup
- Created new useEffect for auto-focus that runs when isOpen becomes true
- Uses double requestAnimationFrame for smooth animation timing (ensures styles are applied before focus)
- Focus priority: 1) initialFocusRef if provided, 2) first focusable element, 3) container itself
- Proper cleanup cancels pending animation frames on unmount or when isOpen changes

subtasks.title: Implement focus return on close
subtasks.description: Store the previously focused element and restore focus when dialog closes
acceptance_criteria: Previously focused element stored on dialog open
Focus returned to trigger element when dialog closes
Handles case where trigger element no longer exists
subtasks.notes:
Implemented focus return on close functionality in useFocusTrap hook:
- Added previouslyFocusedElementRef to store the element that had focus when dialog opened
- Capture document.activeElement before moving focus into the dialog (at start of auto-focus effect)
- Added new useEffect that runs when isOpen becomes false to restore focus
- Handles edge cases: checks if element still exists in DOM, is not disabled, and is visible
- Uses requestAnimationFrame for smooth focus transitions after dialog closes
- Clears the stored reference after restoration attempt to prevent stale references

subtasks.title: Implement Escape key handler
subtasks.description: Add keyboard event listener for Escape key to close the dialog
acceptance_criteria: Event listener properly cleaned up on unmount
Only responds when dialog is open

phases.name: Update AlertDialog Components
phases.description: Integrate focus management and ARIA attributes into the custom AlertDialog components in tailadmin-ui

subtasks.title: Update AlertDialog component with useFocusTrap
subtasks.description: Integrate the useFocusTrap hook into the main AlertDialog component wrapper
acceptance_criteria: onOpenChange called with false when Escape pressed

subtasks.title: Add ARIA attributes to AlertDialogContent
subtasks.description: Add role="alertdialog", aria-modal="true", aria-labelledby, and aria-describedby attributes
acceptance_criteria: aria-labelledby points to title element id
aria-describedby points to description element id

subtasks.title: Update AlertDialogTitle with id
subtasks.description: Add unique id to AlertDialogTitle for aria-labelledby reference
acceptance_criteria: id is accessible via context or passed to parent

subtasks.title: Update AlertDialogDescription with id
subtasks.description: Add unique id to AlertDialogDescription for aria-describedby reference
acceptance_criteria: id is accessible via context or passed to parent

subtasks.title: Create AlertDialogContext for state sharing
subtasks.description: Create a React Context to share dialog state, onOpenChange, and generated IDs between components
acceptance_criteria: Context provides open state, onOpenChange callback
All child components consume context properly

phases.name: Testing and Validation
phases.description: Test accessibility improvements and verify WCAG compliance

subtasks.title: Manual accessibility testing
subtasks.description: Verify focus trap behavior, keyboard navigation, and screen reader compatibility
acceptance_criteria: Focus returns to trigger on close
Screen readers announce dialog role and labels

subtasks.title: Update E2E tests
subtasks.description: Update existing E2E tests to verify new accessibility attributes

subtasks.title: Build and verify no regressions
subtasks.description: Run full build and test suite to ensure no breaking changes

final_acceptance: Focus is trapped within AlertDialog when open
Pressing Tab/Shift+Tab cycles through focusable elements without escaping
First focusable element receives focus when dialog opens
Focus returns to trigger element when dialog closes
role="alertdialog" attribute present on dialog content
aria-modal="true" attribute present on dialog content
technical_notes: The Radix UI AlertDialog (web/src/components/ui/alert-dialog.jsx) already has these features built-in
This task focuses on the custom AlertDialog in web/src/components/tailadmin-ui/index.jsx
Use useId() from React 18 for generating unique IDs
Consider using inert attribute on background content for better isolation
Focus trap must handle dynamic content (elements added/removed after dialog opens)
